net.snortum.utils

Class Reflector

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.snortum.utils.Reflector

  • public class Reflector
extends Object

    Hides some of the complexity and error checking of Reflection.

    The ultimate goal of using Reflector is to invoke some method of a class. To facilitate this, Reflector stores intermediate objects in fields. The caller sets these fields with the various loadXXX(...) methods of Reflector. Say you want to invoke a method in a jar file and need to load it dynamically. You could use Reflector in this manner:

         Reflector r = new Reflector();
     r.loadClass(<className>, <pathToJar>);
     r.loadConstructor();
     r.loadNewInstance();
     r.loadMethod(<methodName>);
     Object foo = r.invoke();

    Note that the Object type should be the type the loaded method returns. The calls to loadConstuctor() and loadNewInstance() can be skipped if the loaded method is static.

    Since all intermediate objects (class, constructor, etc.) are held internally, you can reuse the Reflector object for another method call on the same instance, for example:

         r.loadMethod(<anotherMethodName>);
     Object bar = r.invoke();
    Version:
    2017.10.20
    Author:
    Knute Snortum

    • Constructor Detail

        public Reflector()

    • Method Detail

      • loadClass

        public void loadClass(String className,
                      ClassLoader parent,
                      String... paths)
        Load a class reference for this fully qualified class name. Use a URLClassLoader built from these paths and this parent. This class reference is typically used to find methods in a dynamically loaded jar file.
        Parameters:
        className - the fully qualified class name
        parent - the parent for the constructed class loader
        paths - one of more paths with a valid URL string format for the constructed class loader
        See Also:
        loadClassLoader(ClassLoader, String...), loadClass(String, ClassLoader)

      • loadClass

        public void loadClass(String className,
                      String... paths)
        Load a class reference for this fully qualified class name. Use a URLClassLoader built from these paths. The parent of the constructed class loader is Reflector's class loader. This class reference is typically used to find methods in a dynamically loaded jar file.
        Parameters:
        className - the fully qualified class name
        paths - one of more paths with a valid URL string format for the constructed class loader
        See Also:
        loadClassLoader(String...), loadClass(String, ClassLoader)

      • loadClass

        public void loadClass(String className,
                      ClassLoader loader)
        Load a class reference for this fully qualified class name and class loader.
        Parameters:
        className - the fully qualified class name
        loader - the class loader parent to build the class reference from

      • loadClass

        public void loadClass(String className)
        Load a class reference for this fully qualified class name.
        Parameters:
        className - the fully qualified class name

      • loadClassLoader

        public void loadClassLoader(ClassLoader parent,
                            String... paths)
        Sets the loader field to a URLClassLoader reference based on the paths and parent class loader passed. The paths array cannot be null or empty. If the parent is null then it is set to this class's class loader.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent class loader, or null
        paths - one or more path(s) to build the class loader with

      • loadClassLoader

        public void loadClassLoader(String... paths)
        Sets the loader field to a URLClassLoader reference based on the paths passed. The paths array cannot be null or empty. The parent class loader is set to this class's class loader.
        Parameters:
        paths - one or more path(s) to build the class loader with
        See Also:
        loadClassLoader(ClassLoader, String...)

      • loadConstructor

        public void loadConstructor(Class<?>... paramTypes)
        Set the constructor field to a reference to the loaded class's constructor based on a signature of the loaded class's constructor. One of the loadClass() methods must be called first. Calling this method is not necessary if the method you wish to invoke is static.
        Parameters:
        paramTypes - zero or more parameter types for this constructor
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a loadClass() method has not been called first

      • loadNewInstance

        public void loadNewInstance(Object... params)
        Set the instance field to a new instance reference based on the loaded constructor. loadConstructor(Class...) must be called first. Calling this method is not necessary if the method you wish to invoke is static.
        Parameters:
        params - zero or more parameters for this constructor
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if loadConstructor(Class...) has not been called

      • loadMethod

        public void loadMethod(String methodName,
                       Class<?>... paramTypes)
        Set the method field based on the loaded class, method name, and parameter types. One of the loadClass() methods must be called first.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method name as a String
        paramTypes - zero or more parameter types for this method
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a loadClass() method has not been called first

      • invoke

        public <T> T invoke(Object... params)
        Invokes the loaded method and returns the result. The result will be cast to the type of variable the caller is setting. The loadMethod(String, Class...) method must be called first. Result is null if the method is static or an error was encountered.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the result of invoking the method
        Parameters:
        params - zero or more parameters for the invoked method
        Returns:
        the result of invoking the method, or null if the context is void or an error is encountered
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if loadMethod(String, Class...) was not called first

      • getLoader

        public ClassLoader getLoader()
        Returns:
        the loader field (the class loader reference)

      • getClazz

        public Class<?> getClazz()
        Returns:
        the clazz field (the class reference)

      • getConstructor

        public Constructor<?> getConstructor()
        Returns:
        the constructor reference or null if method is static

      • getNewInstance

        public Object getNewInstance()
        Returns:
        the instance reference or null if method is static
